column5: My wife and I want to plan a trip to Canada this year. We do a lot of Bass and Crappie fishing at home but my wife wants to go North and catch a large Pike. We live in the Northwest part of Illinois and would like to go to Ontario. Would appreciatte it if you Canada experts could tell me of a Lake that we can drive to that could yield some good Pike fishing for us. She would love to catch a 15lb plus Pike...Thanks Dan & Sandy
Well all be drinking that free bubble up, and eating that rainbow stew.....
dan, just drive up to lac seul and fish exclusively for walleye. those slimey buggers will not leave you alone.

Wabaskang Lake on hwy 105 at Perrault Falls, Ont. is known as a world class Pike fishery, and there are several lodges on the lake. Many other lakes in the area produce well too. The big ones tend to hang around reed beds that are close to deep drop offs, suick's work well.
Try Caribou Lake in Armstrong. This lake is loaded with BIG pike and nice walleye that will keep you busy non-stop.

Try Wabagon/Dinorwi, you can catch smallmouth bass, pike, muskie and walleye there. I really like fishing pike there as Dinorwic and the adjacent lakes are shallow lakes with lots of wild rice and weedy bays that tend to hold a lot of pike. Top water plugs, spinners and spoons all work well for pike there.
WE NEED 4 MORE PEOPLE TO GO LAC SEUL FOR JUNE 6-12 FOR REAL CHEAP
Yes, women can't resist me. What does your wife look like?Big Pike ! ;-)

Oh boy..My favorite fish to fish for.I ply Lake of the Woods. Look into http://www.ashrapidslodge.com if you are looking for large pike. The best time I would suggest too if possible would be in August. I know spots their where they rang from 15 lbs and up. Like to 20 lbs on a consistant basis. Right now they have been catching good northern in the 15lb average in a few spots.
we will be heading up to ash rapids at the end of august. any help on where to find these big pike will be appreciated, thanks
